intro: Hieracium hypeuryum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and tall, branched stems that bear numerous yellow-orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disc florets, typical of the daisy family. Hieracium hypeuryum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
